description: Ruben Gutierrez has been seeking DNA tests on multiple crime-scene items from the murder case against him for more than a decade. His legal team says a Texas law blocking his effort is unconstitutional.
title: Supreme Court grants last-minute stay in Texas execution of man requesting DNA tests

description: California Democratic Congressman Adam Schiff released a statement saying it was time for Biden to pass the torch.
title: California Rep. Adam Schiff calls for Biden to step aside

description: Reporter Selina Cheng says she lost her Wall Street Journal job after refusing her supervisor's request to withdraw from the election to lead the journalism group, which advocates for press freedom.
title: Head of Hong Kong's top journalist group says she lost 'WSJ' job due to her role

description: July is Disability Pride Month, an event celebrating the diversity and contributions people with disabilities have made. NPR wants readers to share what they wish other people knew about disabilities.
title: NPR wants to know: What do you wish people knew about living with a disability?

description: Nominations for the 2024 Primetime Emmy Awards were announced Wednesday. The 76th Primetime Emmy Awards will take place on September 15.
title: Here are the 2024 Emmy nominations

description: A hard-hitting exclusive study on workplace issues within the federal judiciary finds fault with the courts’ efforts to police themselves, including a lack of oversight and little record-keeping.
title: Judicial system fails at policing workplace misconduct, study finds

description: Swift's The Tortured Poets Department has been the biggest album in the country for 12 consecutive weeks, the longest run atop that chart of her career.
title: This may sound like a broken record, but Taylor Swift has broken another record

description: Bryant played in the NBA for eight seasons, before taking his playing career overseas. He later coached at a his alma mater, La Salle University, as well as the WNBA's Los Angeles Sparks.
title: Joe 'Jellybean' Bryant, former NBA player and father of Kobe Bryant, dies at 69

description: Jarren Duran hit a tie-breaking two-run homer for the American League and was named the most valuable player. Pittsburgh rookie Paul Skenes pitched a hitless first inning for the National League.
title: Jarren Duran's 2-run homer lifts American League in All-Star Game

description: Reality TV stars Todd and Julie Chrisley were found guilty of conspiring to defraud community banks. Speaking at the Republican National Convention, their daughter, Savannah, blamed "rogue prosecutors."
title: Reality star Savannah Chrisley says her parents were victims of political persecution
